intro: Tiniaria cristata, commonly known as the crested tiniaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly, and often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, pale yellow or white flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a subtle ornamental value. Due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance, it is gaining popularity among plant enthusiasts.
